alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 13 at 6:23PM MST until September 13 at 7:15PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR AREAS NEAR PAULDEN...MOUNT HOPE...AND THE WALNUT CREEK RANGER STATION IN WESTERN YAVAPAI COUNTY... At 620 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2.25 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area, especially near Mount Hope. HAZARD...Thunderstorms producing life-threatening flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes, and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Sullivan Buttes, Big Chino Wash in Paulden, Walnut Creek Ranger Station and Mount Hope. This includes State Route 89 between mile markers 335 and 337. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Walnut Creek, Pine Creek, Muddy Creek, South Fork Walnut Creek, Mount Hope Tank, Williamson Valley Wash, Indian Springs Wash, Round Valley Wash, Mud Tank Wash, Butte Wash, Hitt Wash, Big Chino Wash, Graver Wash, Turkey Canyon, Apache Creek, Verde River, Burro Creek, Deep Canyon, North Fork Walnut Creek, Quartz Lead Wash and Antelope Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
